page.title: 08Saxon Church
page.content: The Saxon Church in East Lexham is a major feature of the area's{local {history.}It has possibly the oldest Church Tower in England and because of this has become an attraction for {tourism.}It used to be the centre of a Saxon village traces of which can still be found in the woods nearby. The Church itself is a small building with an interior length of approximately 18 metres.The inside of the{building}is extremely well cared for and is a good facilty in which to practice{religion.}Extensive rebuilding has been carried out.An example of this is the wall surrounding the churchyard which has been rebuilt by the present Lord of the Manor.{
